org.hps.monitoring.application.util

Class ErrorHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.hps.monitoring.application.util.ErrorHandler

  • public final class ErrorHandler
extends Object
    An error handling class which is able to do any of the following, depending on how the users wants to handle the error.

    • Print a message
    • Print the stack trace
    • Log message to a Logger
    • Show an error dialog
    • Raise an exception
    • Exit the application

    It mostly uses the "builder" pattern so that the various handling methods can be easily chained, where appropriate. Some methods are not available for chaining when it doesn't make sense.

      • raiseException

        public void raiseException()
        Immediately re-throw the error as a RuntimeException.

        Additional methods cannot be chained to this as they would not be executed.

      • setError

        public ErrorHandler setError(Throwable error)
        Set the error that occurred.

        This should always be called first when method chaining.

        Parameters:
        error - the error which is any type of Throwable
        Returns:
        this object
